intro: Cyclophorus laevis, commonly known as the smooth cyclophorus, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related genera. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous stems and leaves, which are typically lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying a variety of colors, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Cyclophorus laevis is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
